Module paceManager
Package data

Class Division

java.lang.Object
data.Division
public class Division extends Object
Division objects represent a given "division", or "section" of the pace. Each team chooses a specific division they wish to compete in. For example, the 2021 Hunter Pace had the divisions Pleasure, Hunt, Western, Junior. Each division has its own "optimum time", which winners are calculated off of. The goal of the pace is to get as close to the optimum time as possible.

The optimum time of the division can be set in two ways. Firstly, a goal time can be specified to be a certain time, either from a prior run or an estimated time based off of a trial run. Alternatively, the user can choose to run off of the average (if a goal time is not specified), using the Settings.useAverageAsGoalTime() setting.

Each division has its own UUID. Each team has a field Team.getDivisionUUID() that stores their division's UUID. When a pace is loaded, each team looks up their UUID with all given divisions, and then sets their reference to the division. Additionally, each division keeps its own list of its teams, which is also populated during the loading process. Whenever a team is added or removed from their division, this list is updated using the addTeam(Team) and removeTeam(Team) methods. During saving, each team's division UUID is updated such that they can be assigned at the next load.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Thomas Kwashnak

  • Field Details

    • uuid

      private final UUID uuid
      Unique identifier of this division object. This is how Teams store which division they are in during serialization without referencing the whole object.
      See Also:
      • Team.getDivisionUUID()

    • teams

      private final transient List<Team> teams
      List of team objects within the division.
      is transitive such that teams are not double copied in Pace.serialize(Writer)
      See Also:
      • addTeam(Team)
      • removeTeam(Team)

    • name

      private String name
      Display Name of the Division. Whenever the application needs to display a human-readable name for the division, it uses this string.

    • goalTime

      private Time goalTime
      Optimum Time for the division

  • Method Details

    • getUsedGoalTime

      public Time getUsedGoalTime()
      Fetches the calculation optimum time for the division. If goalTime = null, this will check if the user has specified to use averages as goal times. If so, will return the average goal time, or return null if the setting is set to false.
      Returns:
      goalTime if goalTime != null

      getAverageTime() if goalTime = nulland Settings.useAverageAsGoalTime() = true

      null otherwise.

      See Also:
      • Settings.useAverageAsGoalTime()
      • getGoalTime()

    • getGoalTime

      public Time getGoalTime()
      Returns the optimum time for the division. This value specifies the rankings and winners for the specified division.
      Returns:
      Gets the optimum time for the division
      See Also:
      • getUsedGoalTime()

    • setGoalTime

      public void setGoalTime(Time goalTime)
      Registers the optimum time for the division. If set to null, then calculations will be based off of the division's average if Settings.useAverageAsGoalTime() = true.
      Parameters:
      goalTime - Optimum time for the division. null if removing goal time

      public Time getAverageTime()

      public void addTeam(Team team)
      Adds a new team to the division.

      Does not modify the team or check if the team is set to the division in any way.

      Parameters:
      team - Team to add to the division

      Returns:
      true if the team was able to remove, false otherwise

    • clearTeamsShallow

      public void clearTeamsShallow()
      Clears all teams from the division list. Does not specifically remove each division from the list. Used when updating each team's specific division.

    • getPlaceOrder

      public Team[] getPlaceOrder()
      Obtains a list of teams in the division who have completed and are eligible for a place, in order from closest to the optimum time to farthest from the optimum time
      Returns:
      Array List of eligible teams in order of closeness to the goal time
      See Also:
      • goalTime
